text: DETERMINATION OF STRENGTH OF HOSES AND COUPLINGS,
label: BODY

text: TYPE C, AND CE SUPPLIED-AIR RESPIRATORS
label: BODY

text: STANDARD TESTING PROCEDURE (STP)
label: BODY

text: PURPOSE
label: BODY

text: This test establishes the procedures for ensuring that the level of protection provided by the
label: BODY

text: strength of hoses and couplings requirements on Types C and CE Supplied-Air Respirators
label: BODY

text: submitted for Approval, Extension of Approval, or examined during Certified Product Audits,
label: BODY

text: meet the minimum certification standards set forth in 42 CFR, Part 84, Subpart G, Section
label: BODY

text: 84.63(a)(c)(d), and Subpart J, Section 84.150, Table 8; Volume 60, Number 110, June 8, 1995.
label: BODY

text: GENERAL
label: BODY

text: This STP describes the Determination of Strength of Hose and Coupling Type C, and CE
label: BODY

text: Supplied-Air Respirators test in sufficient detail that a person knowledgeable in the appropriate
label: BODY

text: technical field can select equipment with the necessary resolution, conduct the test, and determine
label: BODY

text: whether or not the product passes the test.
label: BODY

text: EQUIPMENT/MATERIALS
label: BODY

text: The list of necessary test equipment and materials follows:
label: BODY

text: 3.1.1. A source of compressed air (a 300 cubic foot gas cylinder) capable of delivering
label: BODY

text: 250 psig or higher.
label: BODY

text: 3.1.2. Air regulator, Model 8, from Matheson Gas Products or equivalent.
label: BODY

text: 3.1.3. A Helicoid calibrated pressure gauge and connecting fittings or equivalent
label: BODY

text: 3.1.4. Two sections of applicant's supplied-air hose.
label: BODY

text: 3.1.5. A four-inch pulley, or equivalent.
label: BODY

text: 3.1.6. An American Chain and Cable Company Model E Overhead Chain Hoist, or
label: BODY

text: equivalent.
label: BODY

text: 3.1.7. A 45 kilogram (100 pound) weight.
label: BODY

text: Procedure No.  RCT-ASR-STP-0100
label: BODY

text: Revision: 1.1
label: BODY

text: Date: 3 June 2005
label: BODY

text: Page 2 of 7
label: BODY

text: 3.1.8. Two 2-foot sections of strong rope with breaking strength above 250 lb or
label: BODY

text: equivalent.
label: BODY

text: 3.1.9. A safety cable capable of securing both ends of the hose at the coupling or
label: BODY

text: equivalent.
label: BODY

text: 3.1.10. Electric timer, calibrated to hundredths of a minute (Precision Scientific Co.) or
label: BODY

text: equivalent.
label: BODY

text: 3.1.11. A calibrated Tinius Olsen, Model LTCM, compression/tension strain gauge, or
label: BODY

text: equivalent, may be substituted for the pulley, chain hoist, and weights.
label: BODY

text: TESTING REQUIREMENTS AND CONDITIONS
label: BODY

text: Prior to beginning any testing, all measuring equipment to be used must have been
label: BODY

text: calibrated in accordance with the manufacturer's calibration procedure and schedule.  At
label: BODY

text: a minimum, all measuring equipment utilized for this testing must have been calibrated
label: BODY

text: within the preceding 12 months using a method traceable to the National Institute of
label: BODY

text: Standards and Technology (NIST).
label: BODY

text: The compressed gas cylinder must meet all applicable Department of Transportation
label: BODY

text: requirements for cylinder approval as well as for retesting/requalification.
label: BODY

text: Normal laboratory safety practices must be observed.  This includes safety precautions
label: BODY

text: described in the current ALOSH Facility Laboratory Safety Manual.
label: BODY

text: 4.3.1. Safety glasses, lab coats, and hard-toe shoes must be worn at all times.
label: BODY

text: 4.3.2. Work benches must be maintained free of clutter and non-essential test
label: BODY

text: equipment.
label: BODY

text: 4.3.3. When handling any glass laboratory equipment, lab technicians and personnel
label: BODY

text: must wear special gloves which protect against lacerations or punctures.
label: BODY

text: PROCEDURE
label: BODY

text: Note:
label: BODY

text: Reference Section 3 for equipment, model numbers and manufacturers.  For calibration
label: BODY

text: purposes use those described in the manufacturer's operation and maintenance manuals.
label: BODY

text: Use the test operating procedure as follows:
label: BODY

text: 5.1.1. Connect two sections of the applicant's supplied-air hose with coupling (be sure
label: BODY

text: to use the safety cable).
label: BODY

text: 5.1.2. Secure one end of connected hoses to the proper test weight (45 kilograms-100
label: BODY

text: pounds), or to the Tinius Olsen strain gauge (within 1-foot of the coupling).
label: BODY

text: 5.1.3. Place air-supply hose over a four-inch pulley held suspended with a short rope
label: BODY

text: Procedure No.  RCT-ASR-STP-0100
label: BODY

text: Revision: 1.1
label: BODY

text: Date: 3 June 2005
label: BODY

text: Page 3 of 7
label: BODY

text: from an overhead chain hoist, or connect the hose coupling on the other end of
label: BODY

text: the hose to the opposite end of the strain gauge (within 1-foot of the coupling).
label: BODY

text: 5.1.4. Attach one end of connected hoses to a two-stage regulator and compressed air
label: BODY

text: source; attach a female quick connect coupling to the opposite end of the
label: BODY

text: connected hoses.
label: BODY

text: 5.1.5. Slowly increase air pressure within connected hoses until desired pressure is
label: BODY

text: reached and check for signs of possible rupture.
label: BODY

text: 5.1.6. Pull air-supply hose across the pulley until hose becomes taut, making certain
label: BODY

text: that the coupling of the hoses is between the hoist and the weight, or both
label: BODY

text: couplings and the strain gauge is between the hoist and the anchor point (See
label: BODY

text: Figure 1).
label: BODY

text: 5.1.7. Secure remaining end of the connected hoses.
label: BODY

text: 5.1.8. Slowly raise the hook of the overhead hoist and start the timer when weight
label: BODY

text: leaves the laboratory floor, or when the required weight has been reached on the
label: BODY

text: strain gauge.
label: BODY

text: 5.1.9. After five minutes, stop the timer and release the pull on the hose couplings.
label: BODY

text: 5.1.10. Remove pressure from within connected air-supply hoses.
label: BODY

text: 5.1.11. Examine the couplings and hoses for any indications of separation or failure.
label: BODY

text: Note:
label: BODY

text: Photographs may be taken for records documentation.
label: BODY

text: Note:
label: BODY

text: If the hoses pass this test then the same hoses and couplings must be used on the
label: BODY

text: Tightness of Hose and Couplings and Gasoline Permeation tests.
label: BODY

text: PASS/FAIL CRITERIA
label: BODY

text: The criterion for passing this test is set forth in 42 CFR, Part 84, Subpart G, Section
label: BODY

text: 84.63(a)(c)(d), and Subpart J, Section 84.150, Table 8; Volume 60, Number 110, June 8,
label: BODY

text: This test establishes the standard procedure for ensuring that:
label: BODY

text: 84.63 Test requirements; general.
label: BODY

text: (a) Each respirator and respirator component shall when tested by the applicant and by
label: BODY

text: the Institute, meet the applicable requirements set forth in subparts H through L of this
label: BODY

text: part.
label: BODY

text: (c) In addition to the minimum requirements set forth in subparts H through L of this
label: BODY

text: part, the Institute reserves the right to require, as a further condition of approval, any
label: BODY

text: additional requirements deemed necessary to establish the quality, effectiveness, and
label: BODY

text: Procedure No.  RCT-ASR-STP-0100
label: BODY

text: Revision: 1.1
label: BODY

text: Date: 3 June 2005
label: BODY

text: Page 4 of 7
label: BODY

text: safety of any respirator used as protection against hazardous atmospheres.
label: BODY

text: (d) Where it is determined after receipt of an application that additional requirements will
label: BODY

text: be required for approval, the Institute will notify the applicant in writing of these
label: BODY

text: additional requirements, and necessary examinations, inspections, or tests, stating
label: BODY

text: generally the reasons for such requirements, examinations, inspections, or tests.
label: BODY

text: 84.150 Air-supply line tests; minimum requirements.
label: BODY

text: Air supply lines employed on Types C and CE supplied-air respirators shall meet the
label: BODY

text: minimum test requirements set forth in Table 8 of this subpart.
label: BODY

text: Air-supply-lines used with Types C and CE, hose and couplings shall not exhibit any
label: BODY

text: separation or failure when tested with a pull of 45 kg. (100 pounds) for 5 minutes and
label: BODY

text: when simultaneously subjecting them to an internal air pressure of 2 times the maximum
label: BODY

text: respirator-supply pressure that is specified by the applicant or at 173 kN/m.2 (25 pounds
label: BODY

text: per square inch) gauge, whichever is higher.
label: BODY

text: RECORDS\TEST SHEETS
label: BODY

text: All test data will be recorded on the STRENGTH OF HOSES AND COUPLINGS, TYPE
label: BODY

text: C AND CE, SUPPLIED-AIR RESPIRATORS test data sheet.
label: BODY

text: All videotapes and photographs of the actual test being performed, or of the tested
label: BODY

text: equipment shall be maintained in the task file as part of the permanent record.
label: BODY

text: All equipment failing any portion of this test will be handled as follows:
label: BODY

text: 7.3.1. If the failure occurs on a new certification application, or extension of approval
label: BODY

text: application, send a test report to the RCT Leader and prepare the hardware for
label: BODY

text: return to the manufacturer.
label: BODY

text: 7.3.2. If the failure occurs on hardware examined under an Off-the-Shelf Audit the
label: BODY

text: hardware will be examined by a technician and the RCT Leader for cause.  All
label: BODY

text: equipment failing any portion of this test may be sent to the manufacturer for
label: BODY

text: examination and then returned to NIOSH.  However, the hardware tested shall be
label: BODY

text: held at the testing laboratory until authorized for release by the RCT Leader, or
label: BODY

text: his designee, following the standard operating procedures outlined in Procedure
label: BODY

text: for Scheduling, and Processing Post-Certification Product Audits, RB-SOP-
label: BODY
